{"type":"json_schema","json_schema":{"id":3403,"attracts":[],"care_level":"Medium","common_name":"licorice plant","description":"The licorice plant, or Helichrysum petiolare, is a relative of the sunflower native to South Africa. This evergreen shrub is characterized by its velvety gray foliage and yellow summer blooms. The plant was given its name for its distinct licorice scent once the leaves are crushed; this aroma has been used in traditional medicine for its calming and immunostimulatory properties. Licorice plants will reach a height of one to two feet and benefit from full sun exposure. If planted in the garden, it will require regular pruning to maintain its desired shape. This relatively low-maintenance plant thrives in moist, well-drained soil and semi-shade. {"type":"json_schema","json_schema":{"id":3406,"attracts":[],"care_level":"Medium","common_name":"blue oat grass","description":"Blue oat grass has beautiful, steel-blue foliage that provides great architectural interest for your garden. It has long, stiff blades that form an upright growth habit, and reaches heights of approximately three feet tall in optimal SunLight conditions. It can tolerate both droughts and relatively moist soil. It is ideal for xeriscapes or rock gardens due to its drought tolerance. It is also deer resistant and salt tolerant. It is a perennial cool-season grass, and as temperatures begin to rise the foliage will slowly turn tan and eventually cease its growth in hot summer months. It may still send up a few last stems that bloom beautiful white-colored seed heads in early summer. Blue oat grass is easy to maintain with minimal pruning and can bring life to any garden with its lush texture and color.","family":"Poaceae","flower_color":"Bluish brown","flowering_season":"Summer","fruit_color":[],"growth_rate":"Low","harvest_season":null,"leaf_color":[],"maintenance":"Low","origin":["Germany"],"other_name":[],"pest_susceptibility":[],"propagation":["Division","Seed Propagation","Cutting","Layering Propagation"],"pruning_month":["March","April","May","August"],"scientific_name":["Helictotrichon sempervirens 'Saphirsprudel'"],"soil":[],"watering_period":"morning"}}

{"type":"json_schema","json_schema":{"id":3413,"attracts":["Butterflies"],"care_level":"Medium","common_name":"ox-eye daisy","description":"Ox-eye daisy (Heliopsis helianthoides 'Tuscan Sun') is an eye-catching, hardy perennial flower. {"type":"json_schema","json_schema":{"id":3425,"attracts":[],"care_level":null,"common_name":"stinking hellebore","description":"Stinking hellebore (Helleborus foetidus) is an evergreen perennial plant that is native to the temperate regions of Europe and western Asia. It has grey-green, leathery leaves and produces clusters of fragrant, pale green, bell-shaped flowers in early spring. {"type":"json_schema","json_schema":{"id":3474,"attracts":["Butterflies"],"care_level":"Medium","common_name":"daylily","description":"The Daylily 'Black Stockings' is a hardy perennial variety that produces splendid, true-black blooms with curved petals. {"type":"json_schema","json_schema":{"id":3513,"attracts":["Butterflies"],"care_level":"Moderate","common_name":"daylily","description":"The daylily (Hemerocallis 'Flasher') is a beautiful and vibrant addition to any garden. Blooming in a wide array of colors from white, yellow, pink, purple, and red, daylilies have long been a favorite among gardeners. {"type":"json_schema","json_schema":{"id":3562,"attracts":["Butterflies"],"care_level":null,"common_name":"daylily","description":"Daylily 'Malja Golden Zebra' is an exotic looking plant with beautiful gold and green striped foliage and bright yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. {"type":"json_schema","json_schema":{"id":3586,"attracts":["Butterflies"],"care_level":"Medium","common_name":"daylily","description":"Daylily (Hemerocallis 'Pink Super Spider') is a popular blooming plant with large, vibrant pink flowers and lustrous foliage. Daylilies are hardy and low-maintenance perennials that form a long-lasting and attractive bloom in a wide variety of settings. {"type":"json_schema","json_schema":{"id":3601,"attracts":["Butterflies"],"care_level":"Medium","common_name":"daylily","description":"The daylily (Hemerocallis 'Rosy Returns') is a compact and hardy perennial that grows to be about 20 to 30 cm in height, and blooms with large golden yellow flowers throughout the summer. Its evergreen leaves are strappy, and it multiplies readily to form large clumps. Its highly scented flowers open for one day only, giving it one of its other names, the \"minute daylily\". 'Rosy Returns' is a hybrid variety known for its slick, distinctive colour combination of rosy purple and golden yellow. Perfect for a border or path edge, the daylily provides a welcome burst of vibrant colour to any summer garden.","family":"Asphodelaceae","flower_color":"Rose pink with deeper rose eye","flowering_season":null,"fruit_color":[],"growth_rate":"Low","harvest_season":null,"leaf_color":["green"],"maintenance":"Low","origin":["Japan"],"other_name":[],"pest_susceptibility":[],"propagation":["Division","Seed Propagation","Tissue Culture","Grafting Propagation"],"pruning_month":["March","April","May","March","April","May","June","July","August"],"scientific_name":["Hemerocallis 'Rosy Returns'"],"soil":[],"watering_period":null}}

Its striking white and yellow star-shaped blooms contrasted against deep green foliage make for a stunning centerpiece in any garden. Blooming from early to late summer, it can bring long lasting beauty to your environment and your home. It is a hardy plant that requires minimal maintenance, making it perfect for all kinds of gardeners.
